billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Provides for the establishment of a joint budget committee on conference to resolve differences between legislation passed by the senate and assembly
summary: Provides for the establishment of a joint budget committee or conference on appropriations and proposed legislation or resolutions related to the budget to resolve differences between similar but not identical legislation passed by the senate and assembly.

       Introduced  by  Sen.  ROBACH -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Investigations and Govern-
         ment Operations

       AN ACT to amend the legislative law, in  relation  to  providing  for  a
         joint  budget  committee  on conference to resolve differences between
         similar but not identical legislation passed by the senate and  assem-
         bly

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The legislative law is amended by adding a new section 53-a
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S 53-A. JOINT BUDGET COMMITTEE ON  CONFERENCE  ON  APPROPRIATIONS  AND
    4  PROPOSED LEGISLATION OR RESOLUTIONS RELATED TO THE BUDGET. 1. WITHIN TWO
    5  DAYS OF THE PASSAGE OF APPROPRIATIONS AND PROPOSED LEGISLATION OR RESOL-
    6  UTIONS RELATED TO THE BUDGET IN EACH HOUSE OF THE LEGISLATURE, WHICH ARE
    7  SIMILAR  BUT  NOT  IDENTICAL  TO THOSE OF THE OTHER HOUSE, AND WHICH, IF
    8  AGREED TO BY BOTH HOUSES, WOULD CONSTITUTE SUFFICIENT  FUNDING  FOR  THE
    9  SUPPORT  OF  GOVERNMENT,  THE  TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE AND THE
   10  SPEAKER OF THE ASSEMBLY SHALL JOINTLY  CONVENE  A  BUDGET  COMMITTEE  ON
   11  CONFERENCE  TO CONSIDER AND WHICH MAY REPORT UPON SUCH LEGISLATION. SUCH
   12  COMMITTEE SHALL BE CONSTITUTED BY THE FILING OF A JOINT  CERTIFICATE  BY
   13  THE  TEMPORARY  PRESIDENT  OF THE SENATE AND THE SPEAKER OF THE ASSEMBLY
   14  WITH THE SECRETARY OF THE SENATE AND THE  CLERK  OF  THE  ASSEMBLY,  AND
   15  SHALL CONSIST OF THE SAME NUMBER OF MEMBERS OF EACH HOUSE. UNLESS OTHER-
   16  WISE  PROVIDED  IN  THE CERTIFICATE, THERE SHALL BE FIVE MEMBERS ON SUCH
   17  COMMITTEE FROM EACH HOUSE TO BE APPOINTED BY THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT  OF
   18  THE SENATE WHO SHALL APPOINT THE MEMBERS FROM THE SENATE AND THE SPEAKER
   19  OF  THE  ASSEMBLY  WHO  SHALL  APPOINT  THE  MEMBERS  FROM THE ASSEMBLY;
   20  PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT OF EACH HOUSE'S DELEGATION AT LEAST ONE  MEMBER,
   21  UPON THE RECOMMENDATION OF THE RESPECTIVE MINORITY LEADERS, SHALL REPRE-

    1  SENT  THE  MINORITY IN EACH HOUSE.  UNLESS DELEGATED TO THE CHAIR OF THE
    2  SENATE STANDING COMMITTEE ON FINANCE BY THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT  OF  THE
    3  SENATE  OR  TO  THE CHAIR OF THE ASSEMBLY STANDING COMMITTEE ON WAYS AND
    4  MEANS  BY  THE  SPEAKER  OF THE ASSEMBLY, THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE
    5  SENATE AND THE SPEAKER OF THE ASSEMBLY SHALL EACH SERVE AS  CO-CHAIRPER-
    6  SONS  OF THE COMMITTEE AND SUCH CO-CHAIRPERSONS SHALL CONVENE AND RECESS
    7  MEETINGS OF THE COMMITTEE. MEETINGS JOINTLY CONVENED BY THE CO-CHAIRPER-
    8  SONS SHALL BE SUBJECT TO THE PROVISIONS OF ARTICLE SEVEN OF  THE  PUBLIC
    9  OFFICERS LAW.  THE COMMITTEE MAY FILE A WRITTEN REPORT SETTING FORTH THE
   10  JOINT  RECOMMENDATIONS OF A MAJORITY OF EACH HOUSE'S DELEGATION WITH THE
   11  SECRETARY OF THE SENATE AND THE CLERK OF  THE  ASSEMBLY  OR  SUCH  OTHER
   12  COMMITTEES  OR OFFICERS AS MAY BE SET FORTH IN THE CERTIFICATE, AND SUCH
   13  REPORT MAY INCLUDE SPECIFIC BILL LANGUAGE THAT WOULD IMPLEMENT THE JOINT
   14  BUDGET COMMITTEE ON CONFERENCE'S RECOMMENDATIONS.  NO  REPORT  SHALL  BE
   15  FILED  EXCEPT  UPON THE AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF A MAJORITY OF THE MEMBERS OF
   16  EACH HOUSE'S DELEGATION ON THE COMMITTEE. MINORITY REPORTS MAY  ALSO  BE
   17  FILED.
   18    2.  FOR  PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE LEGISLATION TO BE CONSIDERED BY
   19  THE JOINT BUDGET COMMITTEE ON CONFERENCE MAY BE BILLS OR RESOLUTIONS  OR
   20  A COMBINATION OF BILLS OR RESOLUTIONS WHICH HAVE BEEN MUTUALLY AGREED TO
   21  BY THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE AND THE SPEAKER OF THE ASSEMBLY
   22  TO CONSTITUTE LEGISLATION WHICH IS SIMILAR BUT NOT IDENTICAL.
   23    3.  THE CO-CHAIRPERSONS OF THE JOINT COMMITTEE SHALL CREATE SUBCOMMIT-
   24  TEES CONSISTING OF AN EQUAL NUMBER OF MEMBERS OF  EACH  HOUSE,  BUT  NOT
   25  FEWER  THAN  THREE  MEMBERS OF EACH HOUSE, WHICH CORRESPOND TO THE MAJOR
   26  RELEVANT BUDGETARY ISSUES CONTAINED IN THE GOVERNOR'S BUDGET  SUBMISSION
   27  WHICH  REMAIN UNRESOLVED. AT LEAST ONE MEMBER OF THE MINORITY CONFERENCE
   28  OF EACH HOUSE AS RECOMMENDED BY THE RESPECTIVE MINORITY LEADERS SHALL BE
   29  DESIGNATED TO SERVE ON EACH  SUBCOMMITTEE  CREATED.  SUCH  SUBCOMMITTEES
   30  SHALL FACILITATE DISCUSSION, ANALYSIS, AND REVIEW OF OUTSTANDING BUDGET-
   31  ARY ISSUES RELEVANT TO THE BUDGETARY AREAS FOR WHICH THE SUBCOMMITTEE IS
   32  RESPONSIBLE.  SUCH  SUBCOMMITTEES  SHALL  WORK TO ACHIEVE AN APPROPRIATE
   33  ALLOCATION OF STATE FUNDS ALLOCATED FOR  ITS  PURPOSES  AND  TO  DEVELOP
   34  LANGUAGE  TO  IMPLEMENT  PROGRAMMATIC  PROPOSALS INCIDENTAL TO THE ALLO-
   35  CATION OF STATE FUNDS WITHIN THE SUBCOMMITTEE'S AREA OF  RESPONSIBILITY.
   36  UPON AN AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EACH HOUSE'S DELEGATION ON THE SUBCOMMITTEE,
   37  SUCH  SUBCOMMITTEE  MAY  REPORT  ITS JOINT RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE BUDGET
   38  COMMITTEE ON CONFERENCE AT THE CONCLUSION OF SUBCOMMITTEE DELIBERATIONS.
   39  ANY MINORITY REPORT SHALL ALSO BE FORWARDED TO THE JOINT BUDGET  COMMIT-
   40  TEE  ON  CONFERENCE. IN THE EVENT THAT THE SUBCOMMITTEE DOES NOT RESOLVE
   41  ALL OUTSTANDING ISSUES WITHIN THE SUBCOMMITTEE'S AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY,
   42  SUCH UNRESOLVED ISSUES SHALL BE REFERRED TO THE JOINT  BUDGET  COMMITTEE
   43  ON CONFERENCE FOR RESOLUTION.
   44    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
